definitions.definition: feeling annoyed and impatient because you cannot do or achieve what you want

examples.text: It's very easy to get frustrated in this job.
His apathy just made her even more frustrated.
They felt frustrated at the lack of progress.
She sounded rather frustrated to me.
Sometimes he gets really frustrated with his violin playing.
This failure leaves the child depressed and frustrated.
We were frustrated by the long delays.
Airport workers were left to deal with the thousands of frustrated passengers.
She gave a little frustrated sigh.

definitions.definition: having no effect; not being satisfied

examples.text: He stamped his foot in frustrated rage.

definitions.definition: unable to be successful in a particular career
